questions.subject: ComfyUI-Keyframed
questions.question: What is the main purpose of the Keyframed Nodes extension for ComfyUI?

questions.subject: Keyframed Nodes
questions.question: How can keyframes be used to manipulate animation prompts?

questions.subject: Schedule Prompt
questions.question: Explain the function of the Schedule Prompt node and its output.

questions.subject: Keyframed Condition
questions.question: How does the interpolation method work within the Keyframed Condition node?

questions.subject: Curve Arithmetic Operators
questions.question: Describe the available arithmetic operators for curves.

questions.subject: Parameter Groups and Curve Drawing Utilities
questions.question: How can Parameter Groups and Curve Drawing Utilities be used together?

questions.subject: Curve From String
questions.question: Explain the purpose of the Curve From String node.

questions.subject: Evaluation Schedule
questions.question: How does the Evaluate Schedule node work and what is its purpose?

answers.answer: The Keyframed Nodes extension provides a ComfyUI interface to the keyframed library, enabling the parameterization of animations using keyframes.
Keyframes can be used to change the prompts or other settings over time, allowing for the creation of time-varying animations.
The Schedule Prompt node combines the CLIPTextEncode, Keyframed Condition, and Set Keyframe nodes to allow users to easily create and modify schedules of keyframed conditions.
The interpolation method determines how to smoothly transition between keyframes. Options include linear interpolation and various easing functions.
The available curve arithmetic operators include addition, subtraction, multiplication, division (currently broken), and various blending modes.
Parameter Groups can be used to bundle multiple curves together, and Curve Drawing Utilities provide functions for creating and manipulating curves.
The Curve From String node allows for the creation of curves using commonly used notation for curved parameters.
The Evaluate Schedule node evaluates the schedule at a given time or time slice and provides the corresponding conditioning or conditioning batch.
